intro: Espeletia trujillensis, commonly known as the Trujillo espeletia, is a striking plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blossoms. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, featuring dense, woolly foliage that helps insulate it from cold temperatures. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Espeletia trujillensis is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of the páramo ecosystem.
